intro: Holodiscus microphyllus var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smoothleaf holodiscus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, smooth leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in chaparral and coastal scrub ecosystems. Its botanical features make it an important plant for ecological studies and local biodiversity.
